result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daiqwaun S Lucas

records.addlTxt: The court will appoint Dr. Freiburger as the 3rd examiner. My JA shall prepare the order.
ec/pc: DA, Atty Nelson, Atty Rumpf, DHS/MMHI, Dr. Freiburger (10/26/22--ma)
Letter from DA re: Competency Examination
Proposed Order for Competency Evaluation
Competency hearing on December 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 3:32 PM 
Defendant Daiqwaun S Lucas in court, in custody.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for Daiqwaun S Lucas.  Attorney Monica J. Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance- notes victim(s) are present. 
The Court reviews court record. 


Atty Rumpf verifies receipt and report and review with Mr. Lucas.
Atty Rumpf requests a second evaluation be ordered; requests Melissa Westendorf conduct exam.

DA Hall questions Court ability to direct a specific examiner conduct exam. 

DA Hall indicates that State believes current report is adequate and reliable. 

The Court grants Atty Rumpf's request for further examination. 

The Court directs parties to choose an examiner and submit name within one week; each examiner will conduct an examination. 
The Court directs Atty Rumpf to submit new orders with doctors names inserted. 

recess: 3:44pm 
NEXT: Competency Hearing on 12/16/22 at 3:30pm
Competency hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Cassi Nelson

Order for Competency Examination by DHS

ec/pc: DA, Atty Nelson, Atty Rumpf, DHS/MMHI(8/12/22--ma)
Competency hearing on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
order for competency evaluation

--not to discuss the facts or circumstances of case with family members
--no possession of any dangerous weapons, as defined by statute or ammunition
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin

[ma] Case called at  1:02pm [Judge Hue presiding for Branch 3 Intake]
Defendant Daiqwaun S Lucas appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defenders Amber Rumpf & Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).   Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Petig appears at counsel table with ADA Teuber 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.

Attorney Nelson raises competency, requests a competency evaluation be conducted
The Court orders examination, directs proper paperwork be drafted, Court will endorse today
Attorney Nelson proposes Dr. Schoenecker conduct the examination, further that Defense counsel will submit proposed order.
The Court directs examination be conducted by Dr. Schoenecker.
The issue of competency will be addressed by assigned Judge 

The Court verifies review of complaint and probable cause statement, concludes that Judge Dehring has previously found probable cause 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $1 MILLION CASH Bond with conditions:
--not to discuss the facts or circumstances of case with family members
--no possession of any dangerous weapons, as defined by statute or ammunition
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
recess 1:10 pm. 

NEXT: Competency Hearing on 9/29/22 at 8:30am (scheduled off record, date relayed to parties)
